Keyterm: I - De Havilland Model DH 82A 2POLB (Normal and Utility Category), approved February 7, 1966.

Info: Bristol Siddeley Gipsy Major 1, or 1F, or 1C or 1J.

Gipsy Major 1 - 
 Minimum grade 69 Octane. Unleaded. 
 Gipsy Major 1F - Minimum grade 69 Octane (Maximum lead content 3.33 
 milliliters (mls) Tetraethyl lead (TEL)/US gallon. 
 Gipsy Major 1C - Minimum grade 77 Octane. Maximum lead content 3.33 
 mls. TEL/US gallon. 
 Gipsy Major 1J - 
 Minimum grade 80 Octane. Maximum lead content 
 3.33 mls. TEL/US gallon.

Gipsy Major 1 - 
 Maximum continuous (Sea level) 2100 rpm (122 b.h.p.) 
 and 1F 
 Maximum take-off 
 2100 rpm (122 b.h.p.) 
 Maximum overspeed, full throttle, (5 minutes limit) 
 2350 rpm. 
 Gipsy Major 1C - 
 Maximum continuous (Sea level) 2100 rpm (130 b.h.p.) 
 Maximum take-off 
 2100 rpm (130 b.h.p.) 
 Maximum overspeed, full throttle, (5 minutes limit) 
 2400 rpm. 
 Gipsy Major 1J - 
 Maximum continuous (Sea level) 2400 rpm (142 b.h.p.) 
 Maximum take-off 
 2400 rpm (142 b.h.p.) 
 Maximum overspeed, full throttle, (5 minutes limit) 
 2550 rpm.

Maximum Structural cruising 
 115 m.p.h. (100 knots) 
 Never exceed 
 160 m.p.h. (139 knots)

(+7.0) to (+13.5) when anti-spinning strips are not fitted. 
 When anti-spinning strips are fitted on each side of the rear fuselage 
 (+7.0) to (+15.3) under ordinary flight conditions, (+7.0) to (+13.5) 
 under instrument flight rule conditions.
Leading edge of lower mainplane at root.

Longitudinal: Straight-edge on the studs on the outside of the fuselage right hand top 
 longeron. 
 Lateral: 
 Straight-edge clamped to underside of left hand and right hand top 
 longerons in the front cockpit.

1825 lbs. (Normal Category) 
 1770 lbs. (Utility Category)

23 U.S. gal. (1 tank in upper mainplane at -8.3), 
 or 
 29 U.S. gal. (1 tank in upper mainplane at -8.3). 
 12 U.S. gal. auxiliary (1 tank in fuselage at -11.66)

Elevator: 
 Up 11 1/2 + 3/4 inches at T.E.

Down 8 + 1/2 inch at T.E. 
 Rudder: 
 14 1/2 inches left and right at T.E. 
 Ailerons: 
 8 inches up at T.E. 
 1 1/4 inches down at T.E. 
 Slat travel: 
 3 1/4 inches

FAR 21.29 (FAA letter August 19, 1965) 
 Type Certificate No. A8EU issued February 7, 1966. 
 Date of Application for Type Certificate December 11, 1965.

A U.S. Airworthiness Certificate may be issued on the basis of a United Kingdom 
 Certificate of Airworthiness for Export in the Transport Category (Passengers) 
 signed by a representative of the Ministry of Aviation containing the following 
 statement: "The airplane covered by this certificate has been examined, and found to 
 meet the airworthiness requirements of the United Kingdom and conforms to Type 
 Certificate No. A8EU."

A United Kingdom Certificate of Airworthiness for Export endorsed as noted under 
 Import Requirements, must be submitted for each individual aircraft for which 
 application for U.S. Airworthiness Certificate is made. The U.K Certificate 
 of Airworthiness for Export is valid as a basis for issuance of the U.S. airworthiness 
 certificate for a period of 60 days. If application for U.S. certification is made after 
 60 days from the date of issuance of the U.K. export certificate, this certificate must be 
 reissued.

The basic required equipment as prescribed in the applicable airworthiness regulations 
 (see certification basis) must be installed in the aircraft for certification.

Current weight and balance report, including list of equipment in certificated empty weight, and loading 
 instructions when necessary, must be provided for each aircraft at the time of original certification.

The following placards must be displayed: 
 (1) 
 "Speed must not exceed 139 knots (160 m.p.h.) 
 (2) 
 Engine limitations: 
 (a) 
 Gipsy Major 1 or 1F. 
 "Normal full r.p.m. 2100 Max. permissible for not more than 5 mins. 2350 r.p.m." 
 (b) 
 Gipsy Major 1C. 
 "Normal full r.p.m. 2100 Max. permissible for not more than 5 mins. 2400 r.p.m." 
 (c) 
 Gipsy Major 1J. 
 "Normal full r.p.m. 2400 Max. permissible for not more than 5 mins. 2550 r.p.m." 
 (3) "Smoking prohibited." 
 (4) "Normal Category Maximum design weight 1825 lbs. 
 No acrobatic maneuvers including spins approved." 
 (5) 
 "Utility Category Maximum design weight 1770 lbs. 
 No acrobatic maneuvers approved except those listed below 
 Maneuver 
 Entry Speed 
 Chandelles 
 120 m.p.h. (105 knots) 
 Lazy Eights 
 120 m.p.h. (105 knots) 
 Steep Turns 
 92 m.p.h. ( 80 knots) 
 Stalls (except whip stalls) 
 Slow deceleration 
 Spins 
 Slow deceleration

The airplane must be assembled in accordance with the rigging instructions of the De Havilland 
 Maintenance Manual.
The airplane must be flight checked after assembly.
